Metadata.Name: Booking Intake/Personal Property Inventory
Metadata.Summary: The Booking Intake/Personal Property Inventory IEPD was developed for the California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project.
Metadata.Description: A Booking Intake/Personal Property Inventory is completed when a subject is taken into custody by a Law Enforcement Agency (LEA). The LEA sends the form to the Sheriff's Office. The LEA also sends a Probable Cause Declaration and the Intake Form to the Sheriff's Office at the time of booking. The Booking Intake/Personal Property Inventory contains the subject's personal identifying information, arrest information, and personal property information. The Booking Intake/Personal Property Inventory is one of 44 IEPDs developed by the California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project to support information exchange between state and local government organizations throughout the state of California. It could also be adapted for use in other states.
Metadata.Status: IEPD PreBooking complete and ready for implementation
Metadata.ExchangePartners: California state and local criminal justice agencies
Metadata.Process: The form is sent from the Law Enforcement Agency to the Sheriff's Office at the time of booking.
Metadata.Conditions: If a subject is taken into custody by a Law Enforcement Agency.
Metadata.Sponsors: California Department of Justice and other California state and local criminal justice agencies - see master documentation
Metadata.Purpose: To inform the Sheriff's Office of the subject's arrest and personal property collection at booking.
Metadata.ExchangePartnerCategories: California state and local criminal justice agencies
